RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 7F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIDESWIPED stalked from the three path on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took over approaching the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled through the stretch. PERFECT PRINCESS was forced out leaving the gate, rounded the first turn about the three path and bid past the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and dueled clear in second mid-stretch. BLONDE SAMARITAN settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, angled out into the lane and came along for third mid-stretch. ALL THE ENVY came away awkwardly and outward then rated the early pace inside, was pressured nearing the seven sixteenths pole, met approaching the five sixteenths, dropped back into the far turn then faded at the rail. DETERMINED STELLA was forced outward and into Cowgirl Hop leaving the gate then stalked two deep, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and showed little more. COASTING TO WIN veered out leaving the gate then saved ground. COWGIRL HOP bobbled and was bumped after the start and raced well off the pace. ORIGINALLY HAND-TIMED, TIMES CHANGED UPON REVIEW.

ENTRY.NAME: Perfect Princess
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out start,3p 1st turn,bid 3/8,3p far turn,clear 2nd 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 24200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE FEBRUARY 23, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 23 A llowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DULCIMER DAME stalked the early pace, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the lead two deep at the quarter, drew clear midway on the far turn and was kept alert through the stretch. DIVINE FASHION raced in the five path the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn three wide, dug in leaving the turn and cleared second later yards. HIDDEN IDENTITY rated close inside, gave chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced two deep while between horses on the far turn and relented second in later yards. GOLDEN SWEETS rated a slim early lead inside, came under pressure toward the three eighths pole and was met at the rail at the quarter, dropped back midway on the far turn and flattened the final sixteenth. GOLD TIME VIXEN steadied at the start then again in the three path entering the first turn, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, angled out on the far turn, left the turn in the five path and showed little in the lane. WILL TAKE ROSES stalked the early pace from the three and four paths, left the first turn outside, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but flattened in the four path of the far turn. FLAVA'S DREAM settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 49. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NICE BUT NAUGHTY chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, dug in for the lead passing the sixteenth pole and dueled clear later yards. RIVER ROYALE R V F hustled to the front inside approaching the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, raced near the rail on the turn, was met inside the sixteenth pole and relented later yards. MONKEY WRENCH gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and dueled through the stretch for third. BOBBYS CASE LOAD chased the pace, raced in the five path of the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for third. BOO TOO became anxious in the gate and had a brief early lead, gave chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened the final sixteenth. ALLEGHENY HERO gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path. SWEET T showed no speed while racing wide through the backstretch then saved ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: River Royale R V F
ENTRY.COMMENT: up inside 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,met past 1/16,relented

ENTRY.NAME: Nice But Naughty
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,up inside 1/16,dueled clear late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 93. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 36300. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $25,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since J anuary 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 23 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FULLY CONNECTED pressured the pace leaving the seven sixteenths pole, contested the turn at even terms two deep and dug in determinedly to eke out the nod over PRIMAL DESTINY in the final yards. The latter set a pressured pace, contested even terms at the rail on the turn and dug in gamely to deep stretch before giving up the nod. EMPEROROFTHEDARK chased, raced off the rail on the turn, drifted leaving the turn and dug in through the stretch to hold third. INSIDE RISK steadied at the start. gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and raced strong in the stretch. BIG CITY BOB chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and flattened in the lane. SUPER GARNER gave chase, rounded the turn in the four and five paths and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Primal Destiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,even terms rail turn,game lane,gave up nod

ENTRY.NAME: Big City Bob
ENTRY.OWNER: Pleasant Fields at Harmony Hill LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Fully Connected
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,even terms 2d turn,determinedly,took nod late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Consid ered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ACASHA'S INTUITION exchanged contact with NEVERFOLD leaving the gate then stalked inside, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and took the nod under the wire. The latter ducked out and exchanged contact with Acasha's Intuition leaving the gate and raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail, dug in at the rail leaving the eighth pole, took a slim brief lead in deep stretch but was nipped under the wire. LOGSTRADAMUS ducked in and made contact with Hillbilly Rock leaving the gate then stalked off the rail, challenged toward the three eighths pole, contested even terms two deep on the far turn but was outfinished in a game stretch duel. IN HIGH GEAR closed to the lead nearing the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure toward the three eighths, contested even terms nearest the rail on the far turn but flattened late stretch. RED HOT TODDY raced off the pace two deep on the first turn, picked up the chase toward the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail then flattened later yards. HILLBILLY ROCK was bumped inward and into Acasha's Intuition leaving the gate and steadied early, saved ground on the first turn and never factored. YDOUHAVETOBESOMEAN saved ground on the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Neverfold
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,bumped break,chased 7/16,rail far turn,nipped wire

ENTRY.NAME: Acasha's Intuition
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,stalked inside,chased 3/8,3p turn,nod under wire

ENTRY.NAME: Red Hot Toddy
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 2d,chased 3/8,rail far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: In High Gear
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/4,rated pace inside,pressured3/8,rail turn,flatten late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Con sidered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TOUT ENSEMBLE saved early ground, bid approaching the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn at the rail, angled three wide past the eighth pole, dug in for the lead later yards and drew off. LADY CINCO DE MAYO stalked off the rail, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole and dueled for the lead past the quarter, contested the advantage off the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was met in later yards. CONDUCTANCE took the lead and angled to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met past the quarter, raced at a slim disadvantage nearest the rail on the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. TAPPING SOUTH angled to the inside and settled off the pace, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, improved at the rail on the far turn but lacked further in the lane. SUPERSNAKE rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. JACCACI rated close inside, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole then faded on the far turn. JESS FOR KICKS stalked the pace from the four path the opening turn, faded through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the far turn and was eased on the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Jaccaci
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Lady Cinco de Mayo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked,challenged 7/16,nod past 1/4,off rail turn,met later yrds

ENTRY.NAME: Tapping South
ENTRY.COMMENT: angled in early,chased 3/8,improved rail turn,lacked further

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 23 Allowed 2 lbs. A Rac e Since December 23 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DERBY DAY DREAMS pressured the pace through the backstretch and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dueled for the lead past the eighth pole, drew clear inside the sixteenth pole and widened under steady handling. GOLDEN G chased through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and dug in from the head of the lane to take the nod for second under the wire. AMIDSHIPS took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge at the rail on the turn, was steadily handled from the eighth pole but gave up the lead soon afterward, relented mid-stretch and flattened later yards. SETTLEMENT DATE was shuffled back at the start, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path of the turn and passed rivals in the lane. MI GUSTO ES chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail then weakened past the eighth pole. SUBJECT TO CHANGE was bumped leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, eased out leaving the turn but showed little in the lane. FIRST NAVY ADMIRAL broke outward and made contact with Subject To Change then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. CANT STOP THIS MAN gave chase and rounded the turn about the five path. SUPER JORDAN chased outside, rounded the turn in the six path and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Amidships
ENTRY.COMMENT: up 1/2,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 17400. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 23, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Since August 23 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MYSTIFIED settled off the early pace in the four path, saved ground on the second turn then eased out into the backstretch, bid approaching the three eighths pole, raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, took the nod passing the eighth pole, dueled clear mid-stretch and held on. ROYAL CRUSADER rounded the opening turn in the four path and settled off the pace from the seven eighths pole, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out toward the head of the lane, dug in to take second mid-stretch and was gaining on the winner. MY CANDY BIZ rated close to the early pace about the three path, rallied to the lead past the seven sixteenths pole and drew clear leaving the three eighths, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, was caught passing the eighth pole and weakened the final sixteenth. MAKE WAY saved ground off the pace, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. CHARITABLE SPENNY rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure toward the seven sixteenths pole, was caught past the pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn. LIFESPAN rounded the first turn in the five path, picked up the chase approaching the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the four path of the far turn. AUTS REVOLUTION stalked the pace two deep, challenged toward the seven sixteenths pole but faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Make Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Charitable Spenny
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead inside,caught past 7/16,weakened rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Auts Revolution
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Mystified
ENTRY.OWNER: Walker Devin D and Parrish Wallace
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 4p,inside 5/8,bid 3/8,2d far turn,up past 1/8,held on

ENTRY.NAME: My Candy Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,up past 7/16,clear past 3/8,edge rail turn,weaken1/16
